Author: halfwayamused
Text: Your brain actually burns pretty much the same amount of calories whether you're thinking hard or staring at a wall. The difference is <50kcal a day. Most of the energy consumed goes to maintaining involuntary processes.

Author: Orcasarekiller
Text: It's pretty well documented that your brain is one of the biggest consumers of calories, especially sugary carbs, in the body. When. You are stressed and your mind is racing you are the most susceptible for eating because your brain is screaming for energy as it burns it. Believe me, after I get through with a difficult patient or a challenging case at work, I want to eat like crazy!   You have a lot of reasons to be stressed, it sucks but it's ok to feel that way, you've got challenges in front of you. You can and will make it through and come out the other side stronger. :)
